Accounts Application

Database models for the accounts application.

This module defines the UserProfile model, which extends the built-in Django user with additional fields such as identity verification status.

class accounts.models.UserProfile(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases : Model

Profile model linked to the Django user.

This model stores additional information about a user that is not present in the default Django user model. In particular, it includes the identity verification flag.

user

A one-to-one relationship with the user model defined by settings.AUTH_USER_MODEL. Each user has exactly one profile.

Type:

OneToOneField

id_verified

Indicates whether the user’s identity has been verified. Defaults to False.

Type:

BooleanField

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

id_verified

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases : ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases : MultipleObjectsReturned

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
user_id

Views for the accounts application.

This module defines user-related views such as sign-up and logout. It integrates with Django’s authentication framework and custom forms.

accounts.views.signup(request)[source]

Handle user registration.

Supports GET and POST methods: - GET: Render the sign-up form. - POST: Validate and create a new user account. If valid,

the user is logged in immediately and redirected to home.

Paramètres:

request (HttpRequest) – The incoming request object.

Renvoie:

Rendered template with the form on GET or failed POST, or a redirect to home on successful sign-up.

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.logout_view(request)[source]

Log out the current user.

Terminates the user’s session and redirects to the home page.

Paramètres:

request (HttpRequest) – The incoming request object.

Renvoie:

Redirect to the home page after logout.

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponseRedirect

Views for user identity verification.

This module implements simulation and production backends for verifying a user’s identity before allowing enrollment in activities. The simulation mode marks the user profile as verified locally, while the production mode integrates with an external OIDC provider such as Authentic.

accounts.views_identity.verify_identity(request)[source]

Entry point for identity verification.

In simulation mode: - On POST, mark the profile as verified and redirect. - On GET, render the verification template.

In production mode: - Redirect to verify_start to initiate OIDC flow.

Paramètres:

request (HttpRequest)

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponse

accounts.views_identity.verify_start(request)[source]

Start the OIDC identity verification flow.

Stores state in the session and redirects to the configured authorization endpoint.

Paramètres:

request (HttpRequest)

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponse

accounts.views_identity.verify_callback(request)[source]

Handle callback from OIDC provider after verification.

Validates the state, exchanges authorization code for an access token, fetches user info, and updates the user profile as verified.

Paramètres:

request (HttpRequest) – The callback request containing authorization data.

Renvoie:

Redirection to the safe next page.

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponse

Forms for the accounts application.

This module defines forms for user account management, including sign-up with password confirmation.

class accounts.forms.SignUpForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]

Bases : ModelForm

Form for registering a new user account.

Extends Django’s ModelForm to include password confirmation logic. Ensures that both password fields match before saving.

password

The main password field with a password input widget.

Type:

CharField

password_confirm

A confirmation password field, also rendered as a password input.

Type:

CharField

clean()[source]

Validate password confirmation.

Ensures that the two password fields match. If they do not, an error is added to the password_confirm field.

Renvoie:

The cleaned form data after validation.

Type renvoyé:

dict

base_fields = {'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password_confirm': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
declared_fields = {'password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password_confirm': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Middleware for enforcing identity verification.

This module defines middleware that ensures users must verify their identity before accessing enrollment-related views. Admins and superusers are exempt from this restriction.

class accounts.middleware.IdentityVerificationMiddleware(get_response)[source]

Bases : object

Middleware enforcing identity verification for protected views.

If the request targets a view listed in the setting IDENTITY_ENROLL_URL_NAMES and the user is not verified, the middleware redirects to the identity verification process.

Signals for the accounts application.

This module ensures that each user has an associated UserProfile instance. It defines signals that create a profile upon user creation and backfill missing profiles after database migrations.

accounts.signals.create_profile_on_user_create(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Create a UserProfile when a new user is created.

Paramètres:

  • sender (Model) – The model class sending the signal (User).

  • instance (User) – The user instance that was created or updated.

  • created (bool) – True if a new user instance was created, False otherwise.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments provided by the signal.

Notes

  • Wrapped in a try/except to handle migration states where the UserProfile table may not exist yet.

accounts.signals.backfill_profiles(sender, **kwargs)[source]

Ensure all existing users have associated UserProfile records.

Paramètres:

  • sender (AppConfig) – The app configuration sending the signal.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Additional keyword arguments provided by the signal.

Notes

  • Executed after migrations are applied.

  • Creates profiles for users without one.

  • Wrapped in a try/except to handle early migration states.

URL configuration for the accounts application.

This module defines URL patterns for user account management, including sign-up, logout, identity verification, and built-in Django authentication views.

accounts.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'signup/' [name='signup']>, <URLPattern 'logout/' [name='logout']>, <URLPattern 'verify/' [name='accounts_verify_identity']>, <URLPattern 'verify/start/' [name='accounts_verify_start']>, <URLPattern 'verify/callback/' [name='accounts_verify_callback']>, <URLResolver <module 'django.contrib.auth.urls' from '/home/react/Desktop/Entrouvert/publik_famille/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/django/contrib/auth/urls.py'> (None:None) ''>]
